summary: The Technology for Energy Security Act (H.R. 1752) seeks to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the energy credit for qualified fuel cell property. Specifically, it proposes to amend Section 48(c)(1)(E) by extending the current credit, which was set to expire on January 1, 2025, to January 1, 2033. The amendments would apply to property whose construction begins after December 31, 2024.
